intro: Corchorus mitchellensis, commonly known as Mitchell's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit and produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental appeal and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
